```{r}
# Series
# Punto 1
#Definimos la funci贸n
serie1 <- function(n){
  suma1 <- 0
  for (i in seq(1,n)){
    suma1 <- suma1 + ((-1)^(i))*tanh(i)
  }
  print(suma1)
}
x1 <- seq(1,100,5)
y1<- sapply(x1,serie1)

plot(x1,y1, type = "o")
```

```{r}
# Punto 3
#Definimos la funci贸n factorial
mi.factorial <- function(n){
    result <- n
    i <- n
    while (i>1){
        result <- (i-1)*result
        i = i-1
    }
    return(result)
}

#Definimos funcion de la serie
serie3 <- function(n){
  suma3 <- 0
  for (i in seq(2,n)){
    suma3 <- suma3+log(mi.factorial(i),i)/ (i^3)
  }
  print(suma3)
}

x3 <- seq(2,100)
y3<- sapply(x3,serie3)

plot(x3,y3, type = "o")
```
```{r}
max(y3)
```

```{r}
#Punto 4
# Definimos la funci贸n
serie4<- function(x, n) {
  sum(sapply(0:n, function(i) {
    ((-1)^i / factorial(2*i + 1)) * x^(2*i + 1)
  }))
}

#Ensayamos la funcion
n <- 100
x4 <- seq(-pi, pi, length.out = 100)
y4 <- sapply(x4, function(x) serie4(x, n))
sin_values <- sin(x4)

# Graficar los resultados
plot(x4, sin_values, type = "l", col = "blue", lwd = 6, ylab = "sin(x)", xlab = "x")
lines(x4, y4, col = "red", lwd = 4, lty = 2)

```
